intro: Hemicrambe socotrana, commonly known as Socotra's hemicrambe, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in the arid and rocky environments of Socotra, showcasing adaptations to its harsh climate. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
